did.abstract: Adam T. Raczkowski, a World War I veteran of the American army, was gassed by Germans in France in 1918. He received the Purple Heart only 65 years later. Mr. Raczkowski was active in the Polish Falcons in Southington, CT and participated in their numerous sports events. Collection includes a unique photo from a Falcon's field Day in Meriden CT in 1915.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Mr. Adam Raczkowski was born in Shaft, Pa. on January 11, 1895. In 1904 he moved to Connecticut and lived here till his death on August 22, 1985. He was a WWI veteran from the American Army in France. He was gassed by the Germans in 1918 and awarded the Purple Heart for it only in 1984, because at first he didn't have all the documentation that was needed to prove that he indeed was wounded. He was not aware that he had to apply to the military for recognition. Only with the help of Rep. Nancy Johnson from Connecticut, he was able to obtain the necessary information and in March of 1984 received the Purple Heart in Boston, Mass. Mr. Raczkowski was an active member of the Southington Falcon's nest, a Polish American sports organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The material in this collection consists of documents related to Mr. Raczkowski participation in World War I with the American Army in France. Collection includes related clippings, photographs and biographical notes from his wife Anna Raczkowski.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: Adam T. Raczkowski Papers (CPAA 87-01). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

acqinfo.p: Collection was donated by Mrs. Anna Raczkowski, wife of Adam T. Raczkowski. First part consisted of clippings related to Mr. Raczkowski and was donated in 1987, second part was donated in February 1988 and included monograph publications, and photographs.
